loans.use: to purchase a tailoring machine and an electrical generator.

loans.name: Fadel

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 45 years old, married and has three children.

Fadel has been a tailor since 2010. He owns a workshop where he makes, repairs, or alters clothing, professionally, as suits, coats for men. He has sufficient experience in this field, a deep understanding of local customers, and he knows about their needs. He has a good reputation and he is well known in the surrounding areas.

Fadel is requesting a $2400 loan in order to pay the annual rent for his workshop. He is aiming to gain more profits to offer him the opportunity to provide a better life for his family as a whole.

loans.use: to pay the annual rent for his workshop.

loans.name: Loida

texts.en:
Loida is 30 years old and married. She is in the agricultural business, farming vegetables in the Philippines. Loida has requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and farm supplies.

Loida has been farming vegetables for 9 years now, and has borrowed 9 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business. In the future, Loida would like to save enough to buy more farmland.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and farm supplies.

loans.name: José Reynaldo

texts.es: El señor Reynaldo, es habitante del municipio de Ticuantepe , junto a su esposa , los planes hacia su familia es seguir mejorando su humilde vivienda , gracias a los financiamientos anteriores ha logrado mejorar las paredes y el piso del hogar , pero ahora se le presenta una gran situación en el techo de la vivienda ya que está muy deteriorado y en tiempos de lluvia se les pasa el agua y no cuenta con los recursos económicos necesarios para iniciar el cambio de techo , agradece la confianza y el apoyo que le brinda kiva atravez de Afodenic , ya que son muchas las familias de escasos recursos que con su ayuda logran cambiar su calidad de vida .El prestamo lo quiere para comprar zinc
texts.en: Mr. Reynaldo lives in the Ticuantepe municipality with his wife. He hopes to keep improving his families' humble home and thanks to the previous loans he has been able to improve the walls and the floor. Now they need to fix the roof since it is deteriorated and when it rains it floods and Mr. Reynaldo doesn’t have the necessary money to start fixing the roof. He is grateful for the trust and support given to him through Kiva and Afodenic since many families with limited resources are able to change their quality of life. The loan will be used to buy zinc.

loans.use: buy zinc.

loans.name: Martha

texts.en:
Martha, a 40 year married woman, has four children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity, nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past seven years, she has operated a charcoal selling business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of the high cost of transporting the products for her business. Martha dreams of expanding the business to supply a wholesale shop in the future.

With the KES 40,000 loan she wants to purchase sacks of charcoal for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access funds to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Rama

texts.en:
Rama is taking out another Kiva loan of KES 80,000 to establish another business of motorcycle transportation. With the loan, he wants to purchase a motorcycle. The previous loan helped him build a pub for his palm wine business and he has since received high profits from the business.  

Rama dreams of expanding his business of palm wine sales in the future. The loan has helped him to build a permanent house for his family, hence improving their living standards.

loans.use: to purchase a motorcycle for transport business.

loans.name: Amer

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 55 years old and married. He has four children, one of whom works.

Amer has been a store-owner since 2005, where he repairs and sells electric chillers. He has sufficient experience in this field, a deep understanding of local customers, and knows about their needs. He has a good reputation and he is well-known in the surrounding areas.

Amer is requesting a $3000 loan in order to renovate and repair his store. He is aiming to gain more profits to offer him the opportunity to provide a better life for his family as a whole.

loans.use: to renovate and repair his store.

loans.name: Nazih

texts.en:
Nazih is a 47-year-old married man, and the father of four children, who is sacrificing his whole life for their happiness and success. Nazih works in selling and fixing used car wheels. He is an expert in his field and is recommended by almost all of his customers. 

He is an Al Majmoua borrower with a very impressive history of paying back, and has shown that he is a man of his word since he made the exact special improvements on his business as the action plan he had before.

Nazih is applying today for a loan from Kiva's partner Al Majmoua, in order to buy new car wheels to start selling since his clientele is increasing, and some of his customers are requesting new and not used wheels. He wants to please them, and this loan is the best way to achieve what they want. Nazih hopes to continue improving his business and pleasing his customers.

loans.use: to buy new car wheels with special modifications at good prices.

loans.name: Dogo

texts.en: Dogo is taking out another Kiva loan of KES 50,000 for education purposes. With the loan, he wants to pay school fees for his children who attend school. With the previous loan, he managed to get an additional 50 percent profits and he added on his own savings and purchased a motorcycle. Dogo is giving thanks to Yehu and Kiva lenders for giving him loans to boost his business and improve his family's living standards.

loans.use: to pay school fees.

loans.name: Gnambossou Gbeta Group

texts.fr: Le groupe GNAMBOSSOU GBETA est composé de huit personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. C'est la première fois que ce groupe sollicite l'aide financier de ALIDé, afin d'élever le niveau de son activité. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Louise Clarisse est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Louise Clarisse est âgée de 45 ans et est mariée à un plombier du nom de Christophe. Louise Clarisse a arrêté l'école au niveau secondaire. Le couple a deux enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Louise Clarisse vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Le couple se partage les différentes charges de la maison. Pour contribuer aux différents besoins de la famille, Louise Clarisse vend depuis vingt ans des tissus "bazins" par le système de distribution. Cette activité lui permet de répondre sans grande difficulté à ses besoins. Louise Clarisse s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaires et son revenu, Louise Clarisse sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe GNAMBOSSOU GBETA, un premier crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
The Gnambossou Gbeta group is composed of eight people who live in the same neighbourhood. This is the first time that the group has asked for a loan through ALIDé in order to take their business to the next level.  The representative of the group, Louise Clarisse, is the one in the photo raising her hand.  Louise Clarisse is 45 years old and is married to a plumber named Christophe.  Louise Clarisse stopped attending school at the secondary level.  The couple has two children, both of whom are in school and dependents.

Louise Clarisse livers together with her husband and children.  The couple shares the different household needs.  To support the family, Louise Clarisse has been selling “bazin” fabrics [damask] for twenty years through a distribution system.  This has allowed her to make ends meet without great difficulty.  Louise Clarisse stocks up at a market in Benin.

In the quest to satisfy her clientele and to increase her turnover and profits, Louise Clarisse, along with the other members of the Gnambossou Gbeta group, is asking for her first loan through ALIDé.

loans.use: to purchase fabrics.

loans.name: Amer

texts.en:
Amer is from Iraq. He is 38 years old, married and has three children. He has been an owner of a plant for water filtration and purification since 2010. He has sufficient experience in this field, a deep understanding of local customers, and knows about their needs. He has a good reputation and is well known in the surrounding areas.

He is requesting a $3,000 loan in order to purchase water filtration equipment for his plant. He is aiming to gain more profits to offer him the opportunity to provide a better life for his family as a whole.

loans.use: to purchase water filtration equipment for his plant

loans.name: Julian Ricardo

texts.es:
Julian es un hombre de 37 años de edad que vive con su pareja y sus 2 pequeños hijos, por los cuales, él  y la madre de sus pequeños dan todo de sí para salir adelante y fortalecerse como familia. Actualmente, esta pequeña familia vive en la ciudad de Ica, lugar que está logrando grandes mejoras económicas y cada día le brinda una mejor bienvenida a los nuevos microempresarios.

Julian disfruta mucho leer y aprender siempre un poco más de lo que sabe, para de esa forma resolver las dudas que sus pequeños puedan presentar en el transcurso de su crecimiento. Julian se dedica a soldar, hacer puertas y ventanas de fierro, el labora un aproximado de 10 de horas, y nos comenta que han existido ocasiones en las que ha tenido algunas dificultades en el diseño de sus trabajos pero con el tiempo ha mejorado y progresado en su negocio.

Julian se dedica a este negocio porque tiene buena cantidad de clientes y básicamente labora en esto, porque le permite generar los ingresos necesarios para solventar los gastos que su familia necesita diariamente. Con ayuda de los prestatarios Kiva, Julian desea comprar maquinaria, una compresora y una soldadora, lo que lo ayudará a mejorar y facilitarle el trabajo diario que realiza. El desea convertirse en un líder en este tipo de negocio e incrementar el número de sus clientes, desea que ya no sean 4 clientes diarios si no el doble o el triple, lo que hará que sus pequeños se conviertan en grandes profesionales.
texts.en:
Julian is a 37 year old man who lives with his partner and 2 young children for whom he and the mother of his children give their all to get ahead and be stronger as a family. At present, this small family lives in the city of Ica, a place that is making big economic improvements and each day give a better reception to the new microentrepeneurs.

Julian enjoys reading very much and learns a little bit more that what he currently does because he wants to answer any of his little ones questions that they may have as they continue to grow and learn. Julian is a welder; he makes iron doors and windows and works about 10 hours a day. He says that there have been occassions when he has had some problems designing his work but with time he has improved and progressed in his business.

Julian works in this field because he has a good number of customers and is able to have enough income to meet all of his families’ daily expenses. With the help of Kiva loaners, Julian wishes to buy machinery, a compressor and a soldering-iron, both of which will help him improve and make his work easier. He wishes to be a leader in this type of business and to increase his customers since he doesn’t want 4 daily customers but double or triple that amount since it will help his little children become great professionals.

loans.use: buy machinery, a compressor and a soldering-iron.

loans.name: Jessica Vianey

texts.es:
Jessica casada, comerciante, tiene su taller de costura en su domicilio, siendo su fuente de ingreso económico. Su esposo técnico eléctrico. Sus proyectos mejorar su condiciones de vida mediante la inversión en su negocio ya que comercializa sus prenda de ropa, así también vende zapatos por encargos. Siempre invierte en compra de materia prima para la costura. Planes a futuro expandir su negocio contratando a un ayudante para elaborar mayores cantidades de prenda y a corto tiempo, cumpliendo con los pedidos. 
Con el préstamo comprara materia prima como: telas para traje de baño, tela para toalla, quimonas, tela de sabana, de bermudas, hilos normales, elástico, zipper, alto seda de bordar. Zapatos nuevos. 
Agradece a la financiera por el apoyo al desarrollo de su negocio y alcanzar sus planes y proyectos para un mejor futuro para su familia.
texts.en:
Jessica is a married businesswoman.  She has a sewing workshop in her home, and this is her source of income.  Her husband is an electrician.  Jessica plans to improve her living conditions by making an investment in her business.  She sells her garments and she also sells shoes through orders.  She is always investing in the purchase of raw materials for her sewing workshop.  In the future, she plans to expand her business by hiring an assistant to make larger quantities of garments, and to make her garments more quickly so that she can fill her orders.

With this loan, she will buy supplies such as: fabrics to make bathing suits, towels, kimonos, sheets, shorts, regular thread, elastic, zippers, and silk embroidery thread.  She will also buy new shoes.

She thanks the lenders for supporting her in her efforts to develop her business and carry out her plans, so that she can have a better future with her family.

loans.use: to buy supplies to invest in her dressmaking workshop

loans.name: Zouheir

texts.en:
Zouheir is from Iraq. He is 32 years old, single and lives with five family members two of whom work.

Zouheir has been the owner of a food market since 2005, selling soft drinks, juices, groceries, cheese, frozen beef, chicken and fish, dairy products. He has sufficient experience in this field, a deep understanding of local customers, and knows about their needs. He has a good reputation and is well known in the surrounding areas.

He is requesting $1,200 loan in order to make a showcase, a sliding door, and to add more foodstuffs. His goal is to gain more profits to offer him the opportunity to provide a better life for his entire family.

loans.use: In order to make a showcase, a sliding door and to add more foodstuffs.

loans.name: Lailatu

texts.en: Lailatu is a 40-year-old married woman. She has 7 children and all are enrolled in school. Her husband works as a fisherman. Lailatu operates a business of baking half cakes and selling them at the market. She has worked in this business for 6 years and was previously selling Khangas. Her primary customers are local residents. She describes her greatest business challenge to be seasonality and her highest monthly expense to be school fees. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Lailatu will use the Kes 25,000 loan to buy more cooking equipment, bales of wheat flour, cooking oil, and sugar. Lailatu aspires to open a big shop in the future. She joined Yehu because of flexible affordable policies that favor customers needs.

loans.use: to buy more cooking equipment, bales of wheat flour, cooking oil, and sugar.

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad is a 45-year-old married man, father of five children. A year ago, Ahmad started a new business that has to do with construction. He sells and transports necessary sand & pebbles requested in such business.
Ahmad used to be a soldier but he retired a year ago, that's why he started this business in order to make new income to cover his family's expenses.
Ahmad applied for a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua, in order to buy extra sand & pebbles necessary for his business.
He is working hard to expand his business and to improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy extra sand & pebbles necessary for his business

loans.name: María

texts.es: Doña María es una clienta de 42 años de edad, casada y madre de cuatro hijos. Vive con su esposo y tres hijos, de los cuales solamente uno es menor de edad. Ella tiene trayectoria en la Fundación. Es trabajadora y dedicada a su familia. Vive en una finca en donde tiene el ganado y otros animales. Su actividad principal es el ordeño de las vacas para la venta de la leche. Tiene el apoyo de una hija para la actividad y su esposo le ayuda en los tiempos libres de él, debido a que es asalariado. Cuenta con cuatro vacas lecheras y cuatro novillas. Tiene solamente un cliente y es una quesera en la misma comunidad, a los cuales le vende la leche. Su meta es lograr aumentar su inventario de ganado para crecer, superarse y vivir del mismo negocio, hacerlo familiar. Hacer una empresa grande y asi buscar nuevos clientes para sus productos. Uno de los obstáculos que presenta su negocio es la inestabilidad del precio de la leche.
texts.en: Mrs. María is a 42 year old mother to four children and is married. She lives with her husband and three children of which only one is a minor. Mrs. María has been a member of the foundation for a while; she is a hardworker and is dedicated to her family. Her main work is milking the cows to sell the milk, and has the help of a daughter and her husband helps when he has free time since he is working elsewhere. Mrs. María has 4 dairy cows and four heifers; she only has one customer who makes cheese in the same neighborhood. Her goal is to increase her livestock inventory to grow her business, get ahead and live off her business, to make it a family affair. Mrs. María would like to have a big enterprise and new customers for her products; one of the obstacles that her business faces is the changing milk prices.

loans.use: buy a bull and a heifer.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To repair his Rickshaw [motor-taxi]

loans.name: Mario Enrique

texts.es:
Mario casado, comerciante de ropas surtidas, zapatos, con el préstamo anterior invirtió en la compra de mercadería para el negocio. Actualmente su proyecto es mejorar la infraestructura de su vivienda y aumentar sus ventas. Tiene su negocio desde hace tiempo siendo la fuente de ingreso económico de su hogar, también es pastor de una iglesia dedicando tiempo para servirle  a Dios. 
Con este ciclo de préstamo comprar mercadería nueva como: blusas, calcetines, camisolines, camisola, toallas, calzones microfibra, bóxer, braseares,  perfumes, trajes para niños entre otros. Sus planes a corto plazo es seguir invirtiendo en el negocio para el bien común de la familia.
Expresando que esta agradecido con la financiera por el apoyo al desarrollo de su negocio.
texts.en:
Mario is married and sells clothing and shoes for a living.  With the previous loan he bought merchandise for the business.  His current project is to carry out home improvements and increase sales.  He has been business for some time, and it is the only source of income for his household.  He is also a church pastor and dedicates time to serving God.

With the new loan he plans to buy merchandise such as blouses, socks, camisoles, undershirts, towels, microfiber underwear, boxer shorts, bras, perfumes, children's clothing, etc.  His short-term plans involve continued investment in his business for his family's common good.  He is very grateful to the financial institution for the support in developing his business.

loans.use: To buy merchandise.

loans.name: Wilson Antonio

texts.es: El profesor Wilson trabaja como coordinador de carrera y docente horario de la Universidad URACCAN, solicita  su 6to crédito para pagar un post Grado en educación,  es un hombre muy responsable, honesto, con mucho espíritu de su superacion personal y profesional, su esposa trabaja como ejecutiva de ventas, ambos estudian y trabajan, son bien luchadores, le gusta el progreso tanto material, espiritual y profesional, tiene 2 hijas, son una familia bien unida que sueñan que sus hijas crezcan sanas, que estudien para que sean en el futuro personas de bien y tener estabilidad laboral para ayudar a su familia ya que son bien humildes y unidos
texts.en: Professor Wilson works as a career coordinator and hourly instructor at the URACCAN University.  He is requesting his sixth loan to pay for a graduate degree in Education.  He is a responsible, honest man with a heightened sense of personal and professional excellence.  His wife works as a sales executive.  They both work and study hard.  He likes getting ahead materially, spiritually and professionally.  He has two daughters and they are a very united family.  His goal is for his daughters to grow up in a healthy atmosphere and study so they can become good citizens and have stable employment, in order to help their humble, close-knit family.

loans.use: To pay for graduate studies.

loans.name: Estela

texts.es:
Estela es una joven de 30 años la cual vive en la ciudad de Ica, ciudad que se caracteriza por su clima cálido en cualquier época del años, asimismo conocida por uno de los atractivos turísticos más importantes del país el cual es la “Laguna de Huacachina”, también por ser una ciudad donde hay mucha agricultura en especial el cultivo de Algodón, uva y esparrago. En su tiempo libre a estela le gusta mucho cantar y sobre todo preparar y comer uno de sus platillos favoritos, el cual es el riquisisisimo “Pollo a la Braza”; ella solo tuvo estudios secundarios debido a los pocos recursos de sus padres, pero le hubiera gustado estudiar Psicología.

Día a día Estela trabaja con mucho esmero en su negocio de venta de abarrotes en la bodega que tiene en casa, ella le dedica a su negocio alrededor de 12 horas diarias y puede atender hasta 40 clientes en el día; ella cree que le va bien ene su negocio porque ofrece una buena atención y tiene precios accesibles para sus clientes.

Estela está muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias al apoyo que le han brindado ella podrá comprar andamios, mostradores, y abarrotes, lo que le permitirá mostrar mejor sus productos y así mejorar sus ingresos para seguir trabajando día a día y realizar su más grande sueño:” Tener un minimarket”
texts.en:
Estela, 30, is a young woman who lives in the city of Ica, which is known for its warm climate throughout the year.  It is also known for having one of the most attractive tourist spots in the country, the "Laguna de Huacachina", and for being an agricultural city where cotton, grapes and asparagus are grown.  In her free time, Estela loves to sing and make her favorite dishes, such as her tasty "Pollo a la Brasa" (roast chicken).  She was only able to get a secondary education because of her parents' low income, but she would have liked to study psychology.

Every day Estela works hard in the grocery store she runs out of her house.  She spends about 12 hours and attends to up to 40 customers a day.  She believes her business does well because she is attentive and offers low prices.

Estela is very grateful to Kiva lenders.  Thanks to their support she will be ble to buy shelving, display cases and groceries.  This will allow her to display her products better and increase her income so she can continue working daily to meet her greatest goal which is: "To have a minimarket".

loans.use: To buy shelving, display cases and groceries.

loans.name: Samer

texts.en:
Samer is a 29-year-old married man who opened his own restaurant three years ago to improve his living situation.
Samer is a hardworking man with 13 years of experience in his industry. He has been an Al Majmoua borrower for two cycles. His previous loan was used to buy materials needed for his business, such as oils and other raw materials. The loan had a very positive effect on increasing his income.
With the profit he made and the help of his new Youth Loan from Kiva partner, Al Majmoua, Samer will invest in making the necessary repairs to his restaurant and buy new machines.
This is an excellent step forward to please his customers and improve his business.

loans.use: To make necessary repairs to his restaurant, and buy new machines.

loans.name: Abass

texts.en:
Abass is a 22-year-old single man who has been working as a barber since 2003. Two years ago he opened his own barber shop and it was a good step forward for proving for himself and improving his living. 

Abass is planning to start an agricultural business that has to do with olives and olive oil, so he needs to buy olive trees. It is for this reason that he has applied for a youth loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua. The loan will provide the necessary capital to start this business.

He hopes to expand both businesses as much as he can to improve both social and financial situations.

loans.use: to start new agricultural business.

loans.name: Juana Elsira

texts.es: Juana Elsira es casada, es dueña de una pulperia y trabaja como docente en la colonia providencia, se caracteriza por ser una mujer muy trabajadora, honesta, de buenos modales, tiene un niño, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo que trabaja en la parcelita que ellos poseen el se dedica a la siembra de Raices y Tubérculos. Juana esta  solicitando su 6to credíto para pagar el curso de titulación para obtener el titulo de Licenciada en Ingles, ya que esta culmminado una de las dos carrera que cursa. Tanto ella como su esposo son muy trabajadores y luchadores, que sueñan con tener un mejores condiciones como toda persona lo sueña y que su linda familia goze de salud y amor a Dios y al projimo.
texts.en:
Juana Elsira is married, owns a grocery store and works as a teacher at the Providencia Colony.  Known as a hard-working, honest, good-mannered lady, she has a son and receives help from her husband who works on a small patch of land they own where they grow roots and tubers.  

Juana is requesting her sixth loan to pay for tuition for her degree in English, since she is finishing one of the two degrees she is studying.  Both she and her husband are very hard workers who struggle to get ahead and improve their lifestyle, so their beautiful family can be raised in a healthy, God loving atmosphere.

loans.use: To pay for tuition.

loans.name: Dania

texts.es: Dania una mujer de 46 años de edad, dedicada y luchadora. Actualmete se siente feliz de contar con su negocio propio de comideria situado en una de las terminales de ruta de nuestra capital Managua; asi como tambien continua en la venta de cosmeticos. Esto con el fin de que sus ingresos sean mayores y asi brindarle a su pequeño hijo de 8 años de edad un mejor nivel de vida. Por ahora lo que más la tiene con inquietud es la instalacion inmediata, de sus servicios higienicos en su hogar, misma infraestructura que le permitira brindarle a sus demas familiares una adecuada y sana salud y es para este propósito que solicita el préstamo ya que su mayor anhelo en esta vida es dar por finalizada todas las mejoras posibles a su vivienda.
texts.en: Dania is a 46 year old woman who is hardworking and a fighter. Right now she feels happy to have her own business, a restaurant located in one of the terminals on the route to the capital, Managua. She also continues to sell cosmetics. She does this to have higher income and to offer her 8 year old son a better quality of life. Right now what she wants the most is the immediate installation of a bathroom in her house. This infrastructure will allow her to offer her family members more hygiene. This is why she is asking for the loan, since her greatest wish is finishing all possible improvements on her home.

loans.use: to install a bathroom in her home.

loans.name: Jhonny Cesar

texts.es:
Jhonny es un hombre al que le gusta mucho jugar al futbol y está muy contento por haberse convertido en un microempresario en estos últimos meses. Actualmente vive en la ciudad de Ica, lugar ubicado al sur del Perú, reconocido por el gran desarrollo económico que se ha venido realizando en los últimos años y también por el incremento y desarrollo de microempresarios.

Jhonny brinda el servicio técnico en la reparación de sistemas frigoríficos, lo que le ha permitido trabajar un promedio de 8 horas diarias y desarrollar su carrera técnica de Mecánica Industrial. El nos comenta que aprendió sobre este negocio gracias a que trabajaba como ayudante en un taller, con el tiempo pudo realizar la compra de los instrumentos que necesitaba y así salir adelante.

Con ayuda de los prestamistas Kiva, Jhonny podrá realizar la compra de una moto lineal, la misma que le permitirá movilizarse y  llegar más rápido a donde sus clientes se lo soliciten. Cuando logre la satisfacción de sus clientes, sabe que mejorará sus ingresos y así podrá tener un taller propio, lo que más adelante le permitirá cumplir el gran sueño de la casa propia.
texts.en:
Jhonny is a man who really likes to play soccer and he is very happy to have become a micro-businessman in the last few months. Right now he lives in the city of Ica, located in the south of Peru. It is known for the economic development that it has undergone in the last few years and for the increase and development of micro-business people.

Jhonny offers technical service repairing refrigerators. This has allowed him to work an average of 8 hours a day and develop his technical studies in Industrial Mechanics. He tells us that he learned about this business thanks to working as an assistant in a workshop. Over time he was able to buy the tools he needed and get ahead.  

With help from the Kiva lenders, Jhonny will be able to buy a motorcycle. This will allow him to get around and arrive more quickly to wherever his customers need him. When he is able to satisfy his customers, he knows that he will improve his income and be able to have his own workshop. in the future, this will enable him to make his dream come true of owning his own home.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle.

loans.name: Benilda

texts.es: Benilda con su credikiva compró cosméticos, bisutería, ropa calzado y perfumes con los que generó nuevos ingresos y respondió a los pedidos de su clientela. En la actualidad se prepara para recibir un nuevo credikiva, mediante el cual comprará mas mercancía encargada como ropa, calzado, bolsos etc. y con ello tendrá sus vitrinas bien surtidas, para impactar a su clientela. Su mensaje a los financiadores de Kiva es el siguiente. “Muchas gracias, por el apoyo económico brindado,  aspiro a seguir gozando de este apoyo para mejorar mi nivel de vida y el de mi familia. “
texts.en: With her Kiva loan, Benilda bought cosmetics, jewelry, clothes, shoes, and perfumes. With these she generated new income and responded to her customers' orders. Right now she is getting ready to get a new Kiva loan, with which she will buy more merchandise such as clothes, shoes, bags, etc. . This way, her display cases will be well stocked to impact her customers. Her message to the Kiva lenders is the following: 'Thank you very much for the support you have offered. I aspire to keep using this support to improve my and my family's quality of life."

loans.use: to buy perfumes, lipsticks, deodorants, exercise books, pencils, pencil sharpeners and other products wholesale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy various products for her shop.

loans.name: Maryuri Nohemi

texts.es: La joven Maryuri de 21 años de edad, cursa el ultimo año de educacion superior en la Universidad URACAN solicita su  primer crèdito a esta institucion con el objetivo pagar su curso de titulacion que la acreditara como Licenciatura en Administraciòn de Empresas, ella aun no trabaja pero si ayuda a sus padres en su negocio de la panaderia que poseen tambien obtiene ingresos de una pulperia, su padre serà el responsable de asumir el pago de las cuotas mensuales, esta familia es de buen vivir en sus barrio, son bien unidos y luchadores que han luchado para sacar a su familia adelante, profesan la relegion evangelica, su mayor sueño en la vida es que su familia gozen de salud y gozar de mejores condiciones.
texts.en: Maryuri is a young 21 year old woman who is in her final year of higher education at URACCAN (Universidad de la Regiones Autónomas de la Costa Caribe Nicaraguense/ University of the Autonomous Regions of the Nicaraguan Caribbean Coast).  She is requesting the loan to pay for official registration of her Business Administration degree. She isn’t working yet but she helps her parents in their bakery business.  She also earns income from a general store.  Her father will be responsible for making the monthly payments.  They are a close-knit family who lives quietly in their neighborhood. They   practice the evangelical religion, and they are hard-workers who strive to get their family ahead.  Her greatest dream in life is that her family enjoys health and better living conditions.

loans.use: to pay for registration of her degree.

loans.name: Haydar

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 39 years old, married, and has three children.

Haydar has been an owner of a car repair and blacksmith shop since 2000. He has sufficient experience in this field, a deep understanding of local customers, and knows about their needs. He has a good reputation and he is well known in the surrounding areas.

He is requesting a $2,000 loan in order to pay the annual rent for his shop. He is aiming to gain more profits to offer him the opportunity to provide a better life for his family as a whole.

loans.use: to pay the annual rent for his shop.

loans.name: Maricar

texts.en:
This is Maricar, 40, resident of Manila, Philippines. Her husband is Rodrigo, a driver, and she is a mother to her two children. She, together with her husband, manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.  

Maricar operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a Php5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 500 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php 10,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Maricar hopes to be able to expand soon, just as she dreams to be able to give her family a good future through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week, and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Paulo

texts.en: Paulo used the previous loan to construct three cottages, but due to high demand he needs more capital to construct more cottages. In his business, he faces challenges of seasonal weather and price fluctuations. His dream is building a permanent home, diversifying the business and expanding the business into new markets. Paulo needs this loan to boost business by constructing more cottages.

loans.use: to construct more cottages.

loans.name: Amos

texts.en: Amos is a forty-year-old married man with three children living in Kasese, Uganda. His personal goal is to educate his children. He operates a retail shop where the major hardships are high transportation costs and inadequate capital to purchase stock. However, he has a goal of diversifying his business to include farming and of expanding his business to new areas. Amos needs a loan to buy stock, like sugar and salt, for resale.

loans.use: to buy stock, like sugar and salt, for resale.

loans.name: John

texts.en: John used the previous loan to buy more spare parts; however, due to increased demand, he needs more capital to stock more goods. In his business, he faces a problem of inadequate capital to purchase more stock. His dream is educating his children, self education and moving his business to a more permanent location. John needs this loan to buy more spare parts for his business.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for resale.

loans.name: Faress

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 35 years old, married, and has six children.

Faress has been the owner of a food market since 2005, selling soft drinks, juices, groceries, cheese, frozen beef, chicken, fishes and dairy products. He has sufficient experience in this field, a deep understanding of local customers, and knows about their needs. He has a good reputation and he is well known in the surrounding areas.

He is requesting a $3,000 loan in order to make a showcase, to pay the annual rent and to add more foodstuffs. He is aiming to gain more profits to offer him the opportunity to provide a better life for his family as a whole.

loans.use: In order to make a showcase, to pay the annual rent and to add more foodstuffs.

loans.name: Alex

texts.en: Alex is a 29-year-old married man with three children living in Fort Portal, Uganda. He owns a retail shop which he started a year ago with personal savings. He faces the problems of price fluctuation, high fuel and transport costs and seasonal weather. His dream is educating his children and buying land to grow crops. Alex needs this loan to buy more sugar, sodas and rice for resale.

loans.use: to buy more sugar, sodas and rice for resale.

loans.name: Beatrace

texts.en: Beatrace is a hardworking mother of 6 children living in Hioma, Uganda. She looks after them alone because she is a widow. She is a farmer and has been farming for 6 years, and recently she ventured into red pepper planting. She faces the challenges of high transport costs and price fluctuations. Her family goal is to work hard and ensure that all her children get educated, and to build a permanent family house. Her business dream is to diversify her business and buy land for farming. She intends to use the loan to pay for labor and seeds.

loans.use: to pay for labor and seeds.

loans.name: Alexander

texts.es: Alexander, tiene la edad  de 28   años de edad, está soltero y vive con sus padres. El pretende con el crédito hacer una mejora de pasto a los potreros. El  pretende invertir en semilla para realizar la siembra del pasto y  luego invertir en mano de obra y para obtener una mejor producción de pasto  y un mejor rendimiento. El quiere obtener mejores pastos para un mejor mantenimiento del ganado y obtener la mayor cantidad de ganancias para su bienestar  y la de sus padres y así tener una mejor estabilidad económica. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El  no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en: Alexander is 28 years old, single, and lives with his parents. With the loan he aims to improve the field's grass and invest in purchasing seeds to carry out planting the grass. Later he aims to invest in labor to achieve better grass production and a better yield. He wants to obtain the best grass in order to have a better upkeep of the cattle and obtain a greater amount of the earnings for his well-being and for that of his parents. In this way he will have better financial stability. This is the first loan that he has received from Fudecosur. He had not previously had other loans with state banks, but Fudecosur has given him the loan with greater ease and at much lower interest rates.

loans.use: to improve the field's grass and with farm assistance.

loans.name: Richard

texts.es:
El sr Richard es un joven empresario, de 35 años de edad casado con la Sra.  Luz con quien tiene 1 hijo varón de  3 años. Viven en casa propia en la ciudad de Villa Elisa, en donde tiene una despensa bien surtida con artículos de primera necesidad, y además de eso cuenta con ventas de todo tipo de productos que realiza en forma de macate (venta ambulante) por el interior del país en especial en la zona del Chaco, donde viaja  2 veces  a la semana.
Richard se define como una persona muy trabajadora y emprendedora, su meta es poder seguir trabajando y de esa forma poder darle a su familia un mejor estilo de vida, quiere que algún día su hijo sea una persona de provecho, que no tenga que pasar por ningún tipo de necesidades.
El solicita el crédito para la compra de yerba, azúcar, golosinas, galletitas, gaseosas, frutas y verduras, con lo cual podrá abastecerse y tener bien surtido su negocio, para cumplir con la demanda de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Richard is an young businessman of 35 years of age. He is married to Luz with whom he has one son who's 3 years old. They live in their own home in the city of Villa Elisa in which they have a well-stocked store of essential items. Moreover they sell all types of products which they carry out by traveling to different neighborhoods throughout the inland part of the country, especially in the area of Chaco where he travels to two times each week.

Richard defines himself as a very hardworking and entrepreneurial person. His goal is to be able to continue working, and in this way be able to provide his family with a better lifestyle. One day he wants his son to be a hardworking person who doesn't lack anything.

He is requesting the loan to buy maté, sugar, candy, cookies, soft drinks, fruits, and vegetables, all with which he will be able to stock up and have his business be well-stocked to fulfill his clients' demand.

loans.use: to buy maté, sugar, candy, cookies, soft drinks, fruits, vegetables, etc.

loans.name: Roy

texts.en:
Roy is a 48-year-old married lady with six children. She lives in Kasese, Uganda. She has sold produce for nine years after starting with capital of 400,000 UGX. The business has grown to 8 million UGX.

Roy's major hardships are price fluctuations, inflation, customers not paying on time, inadequate capital to purchase stock and seasonal weather. However, she has a goal of diversifying her business to include farming and expanding her business to new areas. Roy needs a loan to buy beans and groundnuts for planting.

loans.use: to buy beans and groundnuts for planting.

loans.name: Mwanalima

texts.en:
Mwanalima is a 28-year-old, married woman. She has one child who is enrolled in school. Her husband works as a fisherman. 

Mwanalima operates a food stall kiosk where she sells her goods. She was previously selling coconuts. Her primary customers are residents. She describes her greatest business challenge as transportation and her highest monthly expense as school fees. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. 

Mwanalima will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more stock of wheat flour, maize flour and cooking oil for use in her food stall. Mwanalima aspires to open a big shop in the future. She joined Yehu because of its flexible policies that meet customers' needs.

loans.use: to buy more stock of wheat flour, maize flour and cooking oil for use in her food stall.

loans.name: Bassem

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 23 years old and married.

Bassem has owned a food market since 2006. He sells soft drinks, juices, groceries, cheese, frozen beef, chicken and fish and dairy products. He has sufficient experience in this field and a deep understanding of local customers. He has a good reputation and is well-known in the surrounding areas.

Bassem is requesting a $3,000 loan in order to pay the annual rent and to buy more foodstuffs. He is aiming to gain more profits to provide a better life for his family.

loans.use: to pay the annual rent and to buy more foodstuffs.

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en: Rosita, a 47-year-old married mother of four children, lives in Dicoloc, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental where she has operated a general store for 10 years. A member of PMPC for almost one year, Rosita is requesting a loan of PHP 7000 to purchase more goods for her general store. In the future, she hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more goods for her general store.

loans.name: Richard

texts.en:
Richard is a 27-year-old single man. Richard operates a laundry and sells his goods in a shop. He's worked in this business for five years and was previously employed as a farmer. His primary customers are residents. He describes his greatest business challenge as seasonality and his highest monthly expense is food. He owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. 

Richard will use the KES 25,000 loan to purchase a washing machine and detergents. Richard aspires to open a big shop in the future. He joined Yehu because of its flexible policies that favor customers' needs.

loans.use: to purchase a washing machine and detergents.

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
Norma is married and has two children. Norma is 50 years old and lives in Lao Proper, Plaridel, Philippines.

Norma sells groceries to earn a living. She has had this business for two years. Each month, she earns 5,000 PHP doing this type of work. She has requested a loan for 10,000 PHP to buy sacks of sugar, boxes of noodles and sardines, and cases of soft drinks.

Norma has been a member of PMPC for 11 years. In the future, Norma hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy sacks of sugar, boxes of noodles and sardines, and cases of soft drinks.

loans.name: Glenda

texts.en:
This is Glenda, a 44-year-old resident of Manila, Philippines, married to Abundio, a driver, and a mother to her five children. She and her husband manage their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Glenda operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store that retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, Php5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her store is located adjacent to her house, and her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 1000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php 24,000 loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her income as she expands her business.

Glenda hopes her enterprise grows into a mini-grocery, and dreams of giving her children a good and high quality education through all her hard work. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God that she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners who gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items and other products needed in her business.

loans.name: Mwahija

texts.en:
Mwahija, a 32-year-old mother of six children, all enrolled in school, is married to a fisherman and operates a food stall kiosk. Previously employed as a farmer, she has operated this business for two years, and her primary customers are local residents. Mwahija describes her greatest business challenge as seasonality, and her highest monthly expense is school fees. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water.

Mwahija is requesting this Kes 20,000 loan to buy more bundles of maize flour, wheat flour and cooking oil. She aspires to expand the business by opening a retail shop in the future. She joined Yehu because of the flexible and affordable financial services it offers to customers.

loans.use: to buy more bundles of maize flour, wheat flour and cooking oil.

loans.name: Marinda

texts.en:
Marinda is a 20-year-old married woman with one child who is enrolled in school. Her husband works as a fisherman. For the past five years, Marinda has operated a bakery and she sells her goods at the market. Her primary customers are local residents. Marinda describes her greatest business challenge as seasonality. She owns a house without electricity or running water and her greatest monthly expense is school fees. Marinda joined Yehu because of its flexible and affordable policies. 

Marinda is requesting a 25,000 KES loan to buy bundles of wheat flour, sugar, and cooking fat. Marinda aspires to expand her business by opening a new kiosk in the future.

loans.use: to buy wheat flour, sugar, and cooking fat

loans.name: Améfia

texts.fr:
Améfia est un homme âgé de 39 ans. Il est marié å une revendeuse. Il a 02 enfants, tous à l’école. Le premier a 16 ans et le dernier a 14 ans.  
Améfia travaille comme éleveur d’agouti depuis 2000. Il élève seul à la maison et s’approvisionne à Lomé.
Améfia a requis son premier crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter du véhicule pour commercialiser de l’agouti. 
Dans les prochaines années, Améfia voudrait développer la culture des champignons.  Il dit qu’avec les profits, Il veut améliorer le niveau de vie de la famille.
texts.en:
Améfia is a 39-year old man. He is married to a retailer. Améfia has two children, who both go to school. One is 16, the other is 14.  
Since 2000, Améfia has been raising agoutis (a type of rodent used in Togolese cooking). He works alone from his home, and obtains his supplies in Lomé.
Améfia has obtained his first loan from WAGES in order to buy a vehicle for his agouti business. 
Over the next few years, Améfia would like to become a mushroom grower.  He says that with the profits, he wants to improve his family's standard of living.

loans.use: to buy a vehicle for his agouti business.

loans.name: Noime

texts.en:
This is Noime, 41, a resident of Manila, Philippines. Her husband is Rufo, a businessman, Together with her husband, Noime manages their household while operating her business. She works hard to provide income to cover her everyday expenses.  

Noime operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which sells groceries, toiletries, and beverages. It is the place to go to buy a sachet of shampoo, a small amount of cooking oil, or an egg. Noime makes money by buying supplies at wholesale prices and selling retail. Her store is located adjacent to her house and her regular customers are neighbors and the local community. Noime earns a minimum of 1,000 PHP every day.

Noime is requesting a 25,000 PHP loan to help continue operating her business and buy groceries, toiletries, and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her income as she expands.  Noime hopes to acquire a store in a commercial area and she dreams of giving her family a good future with all of her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up weekly with her co-fellowship* members to share stories about her work and draw strength and inspiration from studying the Word of God. 

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners who meet to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy groceries, toiletries, and beverages

loans.name: Mwanaisha

texts.en:
Mwanaisha is a 35-year-old married woman with seven children who are all enrolled in school. Her husband works as a employee at the water ministry. For the past 10 years, Mwanaisha has operated a fish-selling business at the market. Her primary customers are local community members. Mwanaisha describes her greatest business challenge to be seasonality. She owns a house without electricity or running water and her highest monthly expense is school fees. Mwanaisha joined Yehu because of its flexible and affordable policies.

Mwanaisha is requesting a 50,000 KES loan to buy more bundles of fish. She aspires to expand her business and open a new kiosk in the future.

loans.use: to buy fish to sell

loans.name: Emelia

texts.en:
This is Emelia, 47, a resident of Pasay City, Philippines. She is married to Yonilo, a driver. The couple has children. Emelia, together with her husband, manages her household while operating her business. She works hard to provide income to cover her everyday expenses.  

Emelia operates a retail footwear business and she sells shoes, sandals, and other similar products. She buys general merchandise from wholesalers and then sells it retail to make a little profit. Customers are attracted to her low prices and many product options. Emelia's regular customers are her neighbors and local community members. She earns a minimum of 500 PHP in sales every day.

Emelia is requesting a 21,000 PHP loan to buy more quantities and varieties of sandals and slippers to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her income as she expands.  Emelia hopes to expand her business in the coming year and give her children a high-quality education through all of her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up weekly with her co-fellowship* members to share stories about her work and draw strength and inspiration from studying the Word of God. 

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners who meet to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy slippers and other products for her business

loans.name: Mwanasha

texts.en:
Mwanasha is a 24-year-old married woman with two children who are enrolled in school. For the past year, she has operated a business kiosk where she sells goods, and her customers are local residents. Mwanasha's greatest business challenge is seasonality. She lives in a house without electricity or running water and her greatest monthly expense is school fees. Mwanasha joined Yehu because of its flexible and affordable policies.

Mwanasha is requesting a 50,000 KES loan to buy more cereals such as beans, rice, and coconuts to sell. She aspires to expand her business and open a new kiosk in the future.

loans.use: to buy beans, rice, and coconuts

loans.name: Tima

texts.en:
Tima is a 34-year-old married woman. She has six children and all are enrolled in school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water.

Tima is a fish monger and sells her goods at the market. She's worked in this business for eight years. Her primary customers are local residents. She describes her greatest business challenge as seasonality and her highest monthly expense is school fees.  

Tima will use the KES 10,000 loan to buy bundles of fish for sale. Tima aspires to open a new kiosk in the future. She joined Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to buy bundles of fish for sale.

loans.name: Miaad

texts.en:
Miaad is from Iraq. He is 42 years old, married and has three children.

Miaad has owned a food market since 2006, selling soft drinks, juices, groceries, cheese, frozen beef, chicken and fish, and dairy products. He has sufficient experience in this field, a deep understanding of local customers, and knowledge of their needs. He has a good reputation and he is well known in the surrounding areas.

He is requesting a $2,400 loan in order to paint his market’s wall and to add more food. He is aiming to gain more profits to offer him the opportunity to provide a better life for his family.

loans.use: to paint his market’s wall and to add more food.

loans.name: Juanito

texts.en:
This is Juanito, 54, a resident of Manila, Philippines. Single, he manages his own household while operating the business. At this time, he is working hard to continually provide income for his everyday expenses.  

Juanito operates a buy and sell business. He buys used furniture from his contact companies, repairs it and sells it for a profit. His products are office tables, cabinets and other office furniture. Customers are attracted to buy because of the low selling prices and the many options he offers. His regular customers are his neighbors and the local community. He earns a minimum of 800 PHP in sales every day.

To help him continue operations of his business, he is requesting a PHP 21,000 loan. He will be using the loan to buy more quantities of used furniture needed in his business. He expects a boost in his business income as he expands his business.  

Juanito dreams of having his own warehouse and also being able to give support to his relatives. He faithfully meets with his co-fellowship members to share stories of his work every week and where he can also draw strength and inspiration from the word of God he studies. 

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for additional stocks of used office furniture needed in his business.

loans.name: Duhindurimikorere Group

texts.fr:
Godefroid fait partie du groupe Duhindurimikorere. Il a 35 ans, il est marie avec 4 enfants de 3 ans à 11 ans, dont 3 scolarises. Il a 1 personne dans son charge autre que ses enfants Son niveau d’éducation est de 1 ans de secondaire.

Godefroid est agriculteur de riz. C’est son premier cycle de prêt avec ACB. Il va utiliser son crédit afin d’acheter des engrais chimique et payer la main d’œuvre.

Sa stratégie pour la croissance de son business est de solliciter d’autre crédit pour renforcer son agriculture de riz pour être un agriculteur professionnel. Dans les prochaines années, Godefroid voudrait être le premier agriculteur dans sa région. Avec les profits, il prévoit de scolariser ses enfants.
texts.en:
Godefroid is a member of the group Duhindurimikorere. He is 35 years old and married with four children aged 3 to 11, and three of them go to school. He has one other dependent aside from his children. His education level is one year of secondary school. 

Godefroid is a rice farmer. This is his first loan cycle with ACB. He plans to use the credit to purchase chemical fertilizers and pay for the cost of labor. 
Her business growth strategy is to apply for additional loans in order to strengthen his activity and become a professional farmer. In the coming years, Godefroid hopes to become the first farmer in his region. He will use his profits to provide for his children’s education.

loans.use: to purchase chemical fertilizers and pay for the cost of labor.

loans.name: San Roque Group

texts.es:
Este comité se formo con 17 mujeres de la ciudad de Caaguazú, del barrio San Roque,  quienes se agruparon para formar un  comité donde puedan trabajar juntas y ayudarse las unas a las otras. Ellas son señoras muy responsables y trabajadoras, poseen un espíritu emprendedor y de ayuda mutua. Actualmente se encuentran en el sexto ciclo del programa de mujeres emprendedoras de la fundación paraguaya.
Maria es una de las integrantes de este trabajador grupo, y nos comenta que trabaja en la costura. Este trabajo le ha permitido mantener a su familia y darles todo lo que ellos necesitan para tener una vida digna y sin privaciones. Nos comenta que siempre está llena de trabajo y de pedidos, y es en vista a esto que solicita el crédito, para la compra de telas, hilos, gomas, botones y demás insumos para poder cumplir con los pedidos que tiene, y de esa forma seguir trabajando.
texts.en:
This committee is composed of 17 women from the San Roque neighborhood in the city of Caaguazú. They joined together to form a committee where they can work together and help one another. They are very responsable and hard-working women who have an entrepreneurial spirit and believe in mutual assistance. 

They are actually in the 6th cycle of women entrepreneur program of this Paraguayan foundation. Maria is one of the members of the group and she works in sewing. Through this work she has been able to provide for her family and give them a dignified life, deprived of nothing. She always has a lot of work and receives many orders, which is why she is requesting the loan: to buy fabric, thread, buttons and other supplies. Then she will be able to fulfill all the orders she has received and continue working.

loans.use: to buy fabric, thread, buttons and other materials.

loans.name: Issam

texts.en:
Issam is from Iraq. He is 39 years old, married and has four children.

Issam has owned a shop since 1999, selling various types of cereal grains. He has more than ten years experience in this field, a deep understanding of local customers, and knowledge of their needs. He has a good reputation and he is well known in the surrounding areas.

He is requesting a $2,400 loan in order to pay the annual rent for his shop and to add more inventory. He is aiming to gain more profits to offer him the opportunity to provide a better life for his family.

loans.use: to pay the annual rent for his shop and to add more inventory.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
This is Josephine, 50, a resident of Manila, Philippines. She is married to Hector, a local community official, and mother to their five children. She, together with her husband, manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.  

Josephine operates a food stall. She sells snacks like fruits, juices, and other street food staples. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 300 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 30,000 loan. She will be using the loan to buy more quantities of raw products and supplies she uses in her business. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Josephine dreams of giving her children a good and high-quality education through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for raw ingredients and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is from Iraq. He is a youth client, age 29 years old, and married. He has four children.

Ali has owned a shop since 2006, selling phone accessories, cards and mobile phones. He has sufficient experience in this field, a deep understanding of local customers, and knowledge of their needs. He has a good reputation and he is well known in the surrounding areas.

He is requesting an $1,800 loan in order to pay the annual rent for his shop and to add more inventory. He is aiming to gain more profits to offer him the opportunity to provide a better life for his family.

loans.use: to pay the annual rent for his shop and to add more inventory.

loans.name: Urumuri /  Rbyr Group

texts.fr:
Flodouard fait partie du groupe Urumuri/Rbyr. Il a 42 ans, il est marie avec 4 enfants de 2 ans 10 ans, dont 1 scolarise. Son niveau d’éducation est de 6 ans de primaire.

Flodouard est agriculteur de riz. C’est son premier cycle de prêt avec ACB. Il va utiliser son crédit afin d’acheter des engrais chimique et payer la main d’œuvre.

Sa stratégie pour la croissance de son business est de solliciter d’autre crédit pour renforcer son agriculture. Dans les prochaines années, Flodouard voudrait être le premier agriculteur dans sa région. Avec les profits, il prévoit de scolariser ses enfants et améliore le bien être de sa famille.
texts.en:
Flodouard is a member of the group Urumuri/Rbyr. He is 42 years old and married with four children aged 2 to 10, and one of them goes to school. His education level is six years of primary school. 

Flodouard is a rice farmer. This is his first loan cycle with ACB. He plans to use the credit to purchase chemical fertilizers and pay for the cost of labor.  

His business growth strategy is to apply for additional loans in order to strengthen his activity. In the coming years, Flodouard hopes to become the first farmer in his region. He will use his profits to provide for his children’s education and improve his family’s well-being

loans.use: to purchase chemical fertilizers and pay for the cost of labor.

loans.name: Genesis Padre Las Casas Group

texts.es:
Este Banco comunal se llama “Génesis Padre Las Casas” está conformado por 22 emprendedores, quienes se dedican a diferentes rubros, entre los cuales se encuentran venta de ropa, venta de frutas, venta de verduras, repostería, entre otros. Todos ellos pertenecientes a la comuna de Padre de las Casas, ubicada en la ciudad de Temuco.
María Verónica tesorera del grupo del Banco comunal, quien en la foto se encuentra sentada en primera fila y ocupa el primer puesto de izquierda a derecha. Ella usa anteojos, su cabello es corto con chasquilla y de color castaño oscuro. Viste un chaleco color palo rosa y una polera floreada, además usa jeans.
Ella se dedica a vender ropa nueva, usada y zapatos usados, desde hace 15 años. Además vende tejidos que ella misma realiza y ropa interior. Comenta que tiene un local estable y que paga un permiso municipal, para continuar atendiendo su negocio. Su horario de trabajo es de 8ºº de la mañana hasta las 3ºº de la tarde.
Con el crédito comprará lanas para sus tejidos.
Una de sus metas es seguir creciendo con su negocio y más adelante solo vender ropa nueva, quiere llegar a ser una empresaria.
María Verónica vive junto a su marido y su hija, quien estudia en la educación media. 
Ella se encuentra muy contenta y agradecida de la oportunidad brindada por Fondo esperanza, ya que le permitirá invertir en su negocio.
Respecto al grupo del Banco comunal del cual forma parte, comenta que en éste existe muy buena comunicación. Por otro lado las capacitaciones, le han servido para aprender nuevas estrategias de venta y contabilidad.
Padre Las Casas es una comuna del sur de Chile, cercana a la ciudad de Temuco, región de la Araucanía.  Su nombre le fue dado en honor al sacerdote español Bartolomé de Las Casas, quien fue un defensor de los indígenas durante la conquista de América. Destaca una numerosa población mapuche en esta comuna. Basa su economía en la agroindustria y servicios comerciales.
texts.en:
This communal bank is named “Génesis Padre Las Casas.”  It is made up of 22 entrepreneurs who all work in different areas, including: clothing sales, fruit sales, vegetable sales, confectionery sales, and other businesses.  They all live in the Padre de las Casas township, located in the city of Temuco.

María Verónica is the treasurer of the communal bank.  In the photo, she is the first person seated on the left wearing glasses, with short dark brown hair and bangs.  She is wearing a pale pink jacket, a floral print shirt and jeans.  

María Verónica has had a business selling new and used clothing and used shoes for 15 years.  She also sells knitted items that she makes herself, and undergarments.  She comments that she has a stable place to sell, and that she pays for a municipal permit so that she can continue with her business.  She works from 8am until 3 in the afternoon.  She will use this loan to buy wool to make her knitted items.

One of María Verónica's goals is to continue to grow her business so that in the future she could sell only new clothes.  She wants to become a businesswoman. She lives with her husband and her daughter, who is in high school.

María Verónica is very content and grateful for the opportunity provided by Fondo Esperanza, because it will enable her to invest in her business.  With regard to her communal bank, she says that within the bank there is very good communication.  Also, the training has helped her to learn new sales strategies and accounting.  

Padre Las Casa is a township in southern Chile, close to the city of Temuco in the Araucanía region.  It was named in honor of the Spanish priest Bartolomé de Las Casas, who defended the indigenous people during the conquest of America.  A large number of indigenous Mapuche people live in this township. Its economy is based on agroindustry and commercial services.

loans.use: to buy wool to make knitted items

loans.name: Bertha Adilia

texts.es: Doña Bertha, mujer esforzada de buenos principios, agradece a Dios por sus dos empleos, el primero en el cual se desempeña como empleada domestica en una Distribuidora y su segunda fuente de ingreso es su negocio de venta de ropa, zapatos y cosmeticos que vende por encargo, negocio que asegura la señora haberlo podido incrementar mediante los financiamientos brindados por Kiva y Afodenic; ya que su señor esposo es albañil pero lamentablemente labora a traves de contratos por lo que en temporadas el sustento y la carga economica le corresponde a ella. Es por ello que su proposito con esta nueva oportunidad de financiamiento es seguirlo invertiendo en la compra de ropa de verano (short, chinelas, toallas, trajes de baños entre otros) y de esta manera ofrecerle a su clientela una variedad de productos y a sus hijos un mejor nivel de vida los cuales dependen de sus trabajos.
texts.en:
Doña Bertha, a woman of strong prinicples, thanks God for her two jobs. Her primary job is as a cleaning lady in a distribution center. Her other source of income is her business selling clothes, shoes and cosmetics. She has been able to expand this business thanks to financing from Kiva and Afodenic. Her husband works as a mason but unfortunately he works on contract and during certain seasons the economic burden falls on her and she is responsible for providing for their family. 

That is why she would use this loan to buy summer clothing (shorts, sandals, towels, bathing suits, etc) and to offer her customers a variety of products. She would also like to provide a better quality of life for her children.

loans.use: to buy summer clothes

loans.name: Caren

texts.en:
This is Caren, 49, a resident of Quezon City, Philippines. She is married to Pedro, a driver, and is a mother to her three children. She, together with her husband, manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.  

Caren operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a 5 PHP-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 1,000 PHP in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a 22,000 PHP loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Caren hopes her business grows into a mini-grocery and dreams to be able to give her children a good and high quality education through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Normal Isabel

texts.es:
La señora Norma tiene 58 años, es una mujer que a través del tiempo ha buscado la manera de salir adelante y progresar junto a sus hijos, ella siempre ha disfrutado pasear con ellos y brindarles la mejor calidad de vida posible.

Norma se dedica durante 5 horas al día a la venta de ropa, tiempo en el que atiende  a un aproximado de 6 clientes, este negocio le gusta mucho ya que gracias a este ha pido generar el dinero suficiente para cuidar de sus hijos. Norma vende ropa para niños y adultos, lo que le permite tener gran variedad para sus clientes y así ellos puedan escoger la ropa que ellos decidan, ya sea para ellos o para regalarlo en cumpleaños o cualquier tipo de festividad.

Con ayuda de los prestatarios Kiva, ella podrá comprar nueva ropa, la misma que desea que sea de otro material para satisfacer necesidades de sus clientes y desde luego incremente el número de estos. Norma quiere que se conviertan en clientes fijos, lo que le permitirá comprar más ropa y lograr los ingresos que ella verdaderamente necesita para agradar su negocio.
texts.en:
Norma is 58 years old and she is a woman who has always looked for a way to get ahead, together with her children. She has always enjoyed spending time with them and providing them the best life possible. 

Norma works 5 hours a day selling clothes, during which time she waits on about 6 customers. She likes this business very much because it has provided her with the income to take care of her children. Norma sells clothes for children and adults and she offers a large variety to her customers. They can select the clothing that they prefer, for themselves or to give as gifts for birthdays or other holidays. 

With a loan from Kiva, Norma will be able to buy new clothing. She would like to buy clothing in different materials in order to meet her customer's demands and expand her clientele. Norma hopes to turn her customers into regulars, which would allow her to buy more clothes and earn the income she really needs in order to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy new clothes.

loans.name: Juanita

texts.en:
This is Juanita, 59, a resident of Quezon City, Philippines. A widow, she manages her household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.  

Juanita operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a 5 PHP-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 1,000 PHP in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a 24,000 PHP loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Juanita hopes her business grows in the coming years. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Angelina

texts.en:
This is Angelina, 58, a resident of Quezon City, Philippines. Single, she manages her household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.  

Angelina operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a 5 PHP-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 500 PHP in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a 10,000 PHP loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Angelina hopes her business grows to a mini-grocery in the coming years. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Mwanamvua

texts.en: Mwanamvua is a 34-year-old married woman. She has 5 children and all are enrolled in school. Her husband works as a plumber. Mwanamvua is a fishmonger and sells her goods at the market. She's worked in this business for 7 years and was previously employed selling coconuts. Her primary customers are local residents. She describes her greatest business challenge to be seasonality and her highest monthly expense is school fees. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Mwanamvua will use the 10,000 KES loan to buy bundles of fish for sale. Mwanamvua aspires to open a new kiosk in the future. She joined Yehu because of its loan products and policies.

loans.use: to buy bundles of fish for sale.

loans.name: Zeneyda De Jesus

texts.es: Zeneyda de Jesus labora para el Gallo mas Gallo desde hace 5 años desempeñandose como ejecutiva de ventas, en el que ha demostrado su gran responsabilidad, honestidad y amos al trabajo que desempeña,  solicita credito para estudiar maestria en docencia universitaria, cuenta con la ayuda econòmica de su esposo quien se desempeña como docente de la Universidad URACCAN ademas poseen ingresos economicos de la finca que estos poseen, tienen 2 niñas que son la alegria de su hogar y su deseos de darle mejores condiciones para que crezcan en un hogar sobre todo lleno de amor, su mayor sueño en la vida es gozar de salud y que famiia permanezca bien unida.
